item.title: Litter from overflowing bin all over the street again., 6th November
item.description:
Once again, rubbish and clothing are strewn across the street from the overflowing bin linked to Clarence Mansions. 1 day after being emptied it is filling up again and clearly attracting vulnerable people who have gone through it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clarence Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two untaxed vehicles have been abandoned within the garage compound at Sedgmoor Place, 6th November
item.description:
There are two untaxed vehicles that have been abandoned within the garage compound at Sedgemoor place for months now. 1st Vehicle: Reg: EO09HHX - untaxed since 1st January 2024 2nd Vehicle: Reg: HK07FNS - untaxed since 31st January 2025 These vehicles need to be ticketed and removed. The create a nuisance as many other residents believe it is ok to park within the compound and block access. It creates an unsafe space.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116, Sedgmoor Place, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extensive and persistent fly tipping, 6th November
item.description:
This is an ongoing problem. The pavement is regularly blocked and unsafe items - including broken glass - are often left here. The root of the problem is the positioning of two commercial bins which none of the nearby commercial premises say they own. The pavement is not wise and enough for the bins in the first place but the flytipping makes it even harder to navigate. Please review location and management of commercial waste in this area generally.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Camberwell Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
